title: Methods in Java

explanation.short: Methods in Java must declare return type and access modifier. They must be inside a class.
explanation.detailed: Java methods (functions) must specify return type, access modifier, and parameter types. Methods must be defined inside classes. Use 'void' for methods that don't return a value. Methods can be overloaded (same name, different parameters). Static methods belong to the class, not instances.

key_points: Must specify access modifier (public, private, protected)
Can be static or instance methods

method_types.syntax: public static int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }

best_practices: Use verb names: calculateTotal not total
Keep methods focused on single task
Return early to avoid deep nesting
Make methods as private as possible

common_mistakes.wrong: public add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }
common_mistakes.right: public int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }
common_mistakes.explanation: Return type is mandatory in Java
Non-void methods must return a value

common_mistakes.wrong: public int add(a, b) { return a + b; }
common_mistakes.right: public int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }
